title: Poland orders the Russian Consulate in Krakow closed after Moscow was blamed for a 2024 arson attack
FDA warns seniors to avoid this vaccine after deadly complications
Trump pledges to lift Syria sanctions as he seals $142bn arms deal on Saudi visit
description: The US president gets a "lavender-carpet" reception on a whirlwind visit of Gulf countries mainly focused on shoring up investment.

title: Israeli air strike on hospital kills 28 people in Gaza, civil defence says
description: Israel's military said it was targeting a Hamas command centre which it said was beneath the hospital.

title: U.S.-China trade war pushed global supply chain near breaking point, new data shows
description: Global supply chain and manufacturing anxiety was near a breaking point, new data indicates, ahead of the U.S.-China trade war de-escalation.

title: Microsoft laying off about 6,000 people, or 3% of its workforce
description: It's likely Microsoft's largest job purge since it said goodbye to 10,000 employees in 2023.

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Trump Administration Live Updates: Judge Allows Deportation of Venezuelans Under Alien Enemies Act
description: The president announced the planned change in U.S. policy during a speech at a Saudi investment forum at the start of the first major international trip of his second term. His meeting with Syria’s new leader will take place Wednesday.
author: The New York Times

title: In Private, Some Israeli Officers Admit That Gaza Is on the Brink of Starvation
description: Israel’s government has publicly dismissed warnings of extreme food shortages after it blocked aid deliveries, but an internal analysis concluded that a crisis looms if food supplies are not restored.
author: Natan Odenheimer and Ronen Bergman

title: US Judge Says Trump Can Use Alien Enemies Act For Deportations
description: A federal judge in Pennsylvania has ruled the United States can use the 1798 Alien Enemies Act to fast-track the deportation of accused Venezuelan gang members in the state's western district.

title: As Trump Visits The Middle-East, What The Gulf Arab Nations Want From US
description: The three energy-rich Gulf Arab nations are leveraging their influence over Trump to secure tangible gains, having built personal ties with the president and pledged trillions in US investments.

title: Menendez brothers: Judge agrees to resentencing over 1989 murders - BBC
description: Menendez brothers: Judge agrees to resentencing over 1989 murders  BBCJudge resentences Erik and Lyle Menendez to 50 years to life  KTLALive updates: Menendez brothers eligible for parole after resentencing  NBC Los AngelesErik and Lyle Menendez can be resentenced, judge rules  CNNMenendez brothers' long-awaited resentencing hearing underway; cousin pleads with judge to free them  ABC7 Los Angeles

title: GOP heavyweights join bipartisan bashing of Trump Qatar jet deal - Politico
description: GOP heavyweights join bipartisan bashing of Trump Qatar jet deal  PoliticoConverting luxury jet gifted to Trump into Air Force One could cost hundreds of millions  CNNTrump Says Gifted Qatari Plane Will Be Temporary Air Force One  BloombergTurning Qatari 747 into Air Force One could cost $1 billion and take years, experts say  NBC NewsBoeing has a contract to replace Air Force One. What’s the delay?  The Washington Post

title: Judge allows Trump administration to use wartime law to deport Venezuelan gang members
description: A US federal judge in Pennsylvania has permitted the Trump administration to deport Venezuelan nationals, alleged to be gang members, under the Alien Enemies Act. This ruling contrasts with previous court decisions that deemed the AEA's use legally flawed in such cases. While allowing deportations, the judge mandated a 21-day notice and a court hearing opportunity for the individuals.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Strong 6.1 earthquake strikes off Greek island of Kasos, eastern Mediterranean
description: A significant 6.1 magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of Kasos, Greece, early Wednesday, sending tremors across the eastern Mediterranean. The quake, centered near Kasos and Crete, was felt on several Greek islands, as well as in Israel and Egypt.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Six killed in Tripoli clashes after killing of militia leader
description: Abdel Ghani al-Kikli, known as Gheniwa, had recently been involved in disputes with rival armed groupsThe killing of the head of one of Libya’s most powerful militias, which has been accused of abusing asylum seekers and faced allegations of crimes against humanity, has triggered armed clashes in Tripoli, resulting in at least six deaths.Abdel Ghani al-Kikli, better known as Gheniwa, the commander of Stability Support Apparatus SSA, one of Tripoli’s powerful armed groups, based in the densely populated Abu Salim neighbourhood, was killed on Monday night at the headquarters of the 444th Combat Brigade of the Libyan army, a source in one of the country’s security forces told Al Wasat television. Continue reading...
author: Lorenzo Tondo in Rome

title: Episcopal church says it won’t help resettle white South Africans granted refugee status
description: Church refuses White House directive, citing longstanding ‘commitment to racial justice and reconciliation’The Episcopal church’s migration service is refusing a directive from the federal government to help resettle white South Africans granted refugee status, citing the church’s longstanding “commitment to racial justice and reconciliation”.Presiding bishop Sean Rowe announced the step on Monday, shortly before 59 South Africans arrived at Dulles international airport outside Washington DC on a private charter plane and were greeted by a government delegation. Continue reading...
author: Associated Press

title: Russia, Ukraine set for first direct talks since war began with U.S. present
description: The new round of negotiations comes amid a long history of delaying tactics by the Russian side as the fighting in Ukraine grinds on.
author: Mary Ilyushina

title: Israel says strikes on Gaza hospital complex targeted underground bunker
description: The strikes hit the European Hospital complex in Gaza, with reports suggesting Israel was trying to kill a high-level Hamas target.
author: Miriam Berger, Shira Rubin, Lior Soroka, Claire Parker, Hazem Balousha
